sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Multi Mill for versatile size reduction, granulation, and milling of pharmaceutical materials using interchangeable screens and impellers.
sections.scope: Applicable to multi-purpose milling activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the multi mill is installed on a stable foundation with proper leveling.
Verify that all safety guards and interlocks are in place and functional.
Check that the milling chamber is clean and free from previous material.
Select appropriate screen based on desired particle size output.
Install the selected screen securely in the screen holder.
Select appropriate impeller type (blade, knife, or pin) based on application.
Install the impeller on the shaft and secure properly.
Set the impeller rotation speed according to material and process requirements.
Close the milling chamber door and engage safety interlocks.
Power ON the multi mill and verify proper rotation direction.
Start feeding material through the hopper at controlled rate.
Monitor motor load and feed rate to prevent overloading.
Observe discharge and check particle size of milled material.
Adjust feed rate or speed if necessary.
Collect milled material in appropriate containers.
After milling completion, stop the feed and allow mill to run empty.
Power OFF the mill and wait for complete cessation of rotation.
Open the milling chamber and remove screen and impeller.
Clean all product contact parts thoroughly.
Inspect screen for damage or wear.
Inspect impeller blades for wear and replace if necessary.
Reassemble the mill for next operation.
Document milling parameters, screen size, and observations in the batch record.
precautions: Never operate without proper safety guards in place.
Do not insert hands into the milling chamber during operation.
Select appropriate screen-impeller combination for the material.
Avoid overloading which can damage equipment.
Monitor motor temperature during extended operation.
Replace worn screens and impellers promptly.
Use dust extraction system to control airborne dust.
Wear appropriate PPE including safety goggles, ear protection, and dust mask.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during cleaning and maintenance.
Clean thoroughly between different products to prevent cross-contamination.
